title.narrative: Improved Pig Production and Market Chains

description.narrative: Pigs are an integral part of farming systems in rural Laos, particularly for poorer families who have limited land and capacity to invest in other produce. Currently, pig production in Laos is not meeting domestic or export demands. This demand is increasingly supplemented by importing piglets from Thailand, and selling fattened pigs to Vietnam. Reduced inclusion, or even exclusion, from these local and export markets by large and foreign-owned farms creates major disadvantages for Lao farmers, as pigs are one of the few cash income generating opportunities. This project responds to the importance of livestock in the Lao economy and the livelihoods of village households. It responds specifically to the limitations of current village-based systems in terms of feeding and reproductive management, the increasing pressure to confine pigs for hygienic and forage delivery reasons and the constant threat of disease incursions.
